meanings.definition: The condition of being lower in status or quality than another or others.
meanings.sent1: She felt a sense of inferiority when comparing her grades to her classmates.
meanings.sent2: His inferiority in basketball skills made him feel discouraged.
meanings.sent3: Despite his inferiority in height, he was determined to excel in the sport.
meanings.sent4: The company's inferiority in technology hindered its growth in the market.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds symbolized the inferiority of the storm approaching.

meanings.definition: A feeling of inadequacy or lack of self-worth.
meanings.sent1: Her constant self-doubt reflected her deep-seated inferiority.
meanings.sent2: His inferiority prevented him from speaking up in meetings.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about his inferiority complex with humor and wit.
meanings.sent4: The shadow cast by the mountain gave an impression of inferiority to the valley below.
meanings.sent5: The protagonist's inferiority drove the plot forward in a compelling way.
